alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:58PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Converse County through 845 PM MDT... At 758 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boxelder, or 22 miles west of Douglas, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Deer Creek and Laprele Reservoir. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 138 and 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
